moves.1. e4: Another game versus one of my co-workers, Ian.  I begin with my usual e4!
moves.1... e5 2. Bc4: I have recently began to like this move more and more.  It feels strong in the center.
moves.2... Nh6: I have never been a big fan of the N on the edge of the board.
moves.3. d4 d6 4. Bxh6: here is why the N should never be allowed on h6.  Now the king side pawn structure is ruined and there's doubled pawns on the H-file.
moves.4... gxh6 5. Nc3 Bg7 6. d5: I had to make a tough decision here, I didn't want to block my N and my light bishop, but I didn't like the exchange problem imposed by his B on g7.
moves.6... c6: Now he made my choice easy opening up the d5 square like I wanted.
moves.7. dxc6 Nxc6: they always say take with the piece worth less.  this move allows me to advance my N, as opposed to if he had taken with the pawn I would've been stuck.
moves.8. Qf3: figured I'd try for a quick mate on f7.
moves.9. Nd5: here's the N move that would've been blocked if he'd taken with the pawn.
moves.9... Qd7 10. Nf6+: Here I know that he must take with the bishop, and I'm then his rook and pawn are en prise.  So I will at least win a pawn.
moves.12... Nd4: Once he made this move I noticed an opportunity to trap his queen if he forks my rook.  Can you see it without looking ahead?
moves.13... Nxc2+ 14. Kd1: I go ahead and attack leaving him with less options.
moves.14... Nxa1 15. Bb5: trap sprung!  Now the Q is trapped.
moves.15... a5 16. Bxd7+ Bxd7 17. Qxd6 Rd8: An evil little plot by my friend, if he bxp then my queen is up the creek...
moves.18. Qxe5+ Be6+ 19. Ke2: Here I knew I would have to come up a rank anyways to free my rook, so I go ahead and take the liberty here.
moves.19... b6 20. b3: A dubious move, just checking to see if I could check and take his N...ya never know unless you try. :)
moves.20... Nxb3 21. Qb5+ Rd7: He did good and kept his bishop on guard.
moves.22. Nf3: N move to keep the forking from happening.
moves.22... f6 23. Qxb6 Rff7: His first REAL blunder.  Leaving the bishop unprotected. The Queen trap earlier wasn't necessarily a blunder, just a technical oversight.
moves.24. Qxe6+ Kf8 25. Qxb3 Rdb7 26. Qd5 Rb2+: After the loss of his bishop and knight, he decides there's no need to advance this game any further.
